title: It takes one fifteen-to-twenty-year-old tree to produce seven hundred paper grocery bags.
A scholar who studies the Marquis de Sade is called a Sadian not a Sadist.
15 million blood cells are destroyed in the human body every second.
There are about 450 types of cheese in the world. 240 come from France.
A group of rhinos are called a crash.
All snow crystals are hexagonal.
Americans on the average eat 18 acres of pizza every day.
The ZIP in 'ZIP code' means Zoning Improvement Plan.
Respiratory Disease is China's leading cause of death.
Baby Ruth candy bar was named after Grover Cleveland’s daughter, Ruth, not the baseball player.
Spain leads the world in cork production
The average person's left hand does 56% of the typing.
All gondolas in Venice, Italy must be painted black, unless they belong to a high official.
The largest NFL stadium is the Pontiac Silverdome in Detroit, Michigan.
By raising your legs slowly and lying on your back, you cannot sink into quicksand.
A snake has no ears. But its tongue is extremely sensitive to sound vibrations. By flicking its tongue, a snake can pick up sound waves-so a snake 'hears with his tongue...sort of!

It was discovered on a space mission that a frog can throw up. The frog throws up its stomach first, so the stomach is dangling out of its mouth. Then the frog uses its forearms to dig out all of the stomach's contents and then swallows the stomach back down.
In France, a five year old child can buy an alcoholic drink in a bar
Iguanas, koalas and Komodo dragons all have two penises.
A species of earthworm in Australia grows up to 10 feet in length.
If each count were one second long, it would take about twelve days to count to a million and thirty-two years to count to a billion.
98% of Japanese are cremated.
Michigan was the first state to have roadside picnic tables.
In honour if Johan Vaaler, inventor of the paper clip, a 221/2 paper clip was erected in Oslo, Norway.
A rhinoceros horn is made of compacted hair.
In every episode of 'Seinfeld' there is a Superman picture or reference somewhere.
Dreamt is the only English word that ends in the letters 'MT'.
Hawaiian words do not contain consonant clusters. For example, Kahlua is not a hawaiian word.
Anne Boleyn, Queen Elizabeth I's mother, had six fingers on one hand.
Frank Lloyd Wright's son invented Lincoln Logs.
There are more than 40,000 characters in the Chinese script.
After eating, the housefly regurgitates its food and eats it again.
Approximately 98% of software in China is pirated.
Jeff Daniels was only paid $50,000 for the movie "Dumb and Dumber". Jim Carrey was paid $7 million.
Italy didn't have tomatoes and India didn't have peppers until the Americas were discovered
England is smaller than New England.
In ancient Rome, commoners would evacuate entire cities in acts of revolt called "Secessions of the Plebeians", leaving the elite in the cities to fend for themselves
In the U.S, Frisbees outsell footballs, baseballs and basketballs combined.
Abercrombie & Fitch offered the cast of Jersey Shore "substantial payment" to stop wearing their brand
Hair is made from the same substance as fingernails.
It is believed that Leonardo Da Vinci invented the scissors.
Your skull is made up of 29 different bones.
Almost is the longest word in the English language with all the letters in alphabetical order.
The volume of the earth's moon is the same as the volume of the Pacific Ocean.
Montpelier, Vermont is the only state capital without a McDonalds.
According to British law passed in 1845, attempting to commit suicide was a capital offense. Offenders could be hanged for trying.
Carnivorous animals will not eat another animal that has been hit by a lightning strike.
Every time you lick a stamp, you're consuming 1/10 of a calorie.
Because of heavy traffic congestion, Julius Caesar banned all wheeled vehicles from Rome during daylight hours.
Despite a population of over a billion, China has only about 200 family names.
Thirty-five percent of the people who use personal ads for dating are already married.
The 'pound' key on your keyboard () is called an octotroph.
On average, 100 people choke to death on ballpoint pens every year.
All of the clocks in the movie 'Pulp Fiction' are stuck on 4:20.
Donkeys kill more people than plane crashes.
Sherlock Holmes NEVER said, 'Elementary, my dear Watson.'
There is a city called Rome in every continent.
The surface of the human skin is 6.5 square feet (2m).
A rhinoceros' horn is made of compacted hair.
Devon is the only county in Great Britain to have two coasts.
Tug of War was an Olympic event between 1900 and 1920.
Stewardesses is the longest word typed with only the left hand.
A forfeited game in baseball is recorded as a 9-0 score. In football it is recorded as a 1-0 score.
The North American PlayStation 1 controller is about 10% larger than the Japanese version, due to a majority of North Americans having larger hands than the average Japanese person.
What is called a 'French kiss' in the English speaking world is known as an 'English kiss' in France.
When you sneeze, all your bodily functions stop even your heart.
Humans use a total of 72 different muscles in speech.
French speaking residents of Belgium are called Walloons.
Approximately 62% of Americans have less than $1,000 in their savings accounts and 21% don’t even have a savings account
Morgan Freeman converted his 124 Acre Ranch into a bee sanctuary in an effort to help bee populations

In Back to the Future, the original idea was for the time machine to be a refrigerator, but because Robert Zemeckis was afraid that kids would imitate the film and get trapped in fridges, they changed it to a DeLorean car.
Some people say that when the black bands on the Woolybear caterpillar are wide, a cold winter is coming.
American astronauts must be under 6 feet.
The town of Calma, Chile in the Atacama Desert has never had rain.

Nikola Tesla predicted the modern cell phone in 1926: "we shall be able to communicate with one another instantly, irrespective of distance. Not only this, but... we shall see and hear one another as though we were face to face... a man will be able to carry one in his pocket"
A full moon always rises at sunset.
Peter McCathie survived being hit by lightning when he was a teenager and now he’s won the lottery — both events combined come to about a 1 in 2.6 trillion chance.
The military under Richard Nixon was ordered not to react to any orders from the president due to his depression.
The invention of the original silly string was accidental.
Thanks to 3D printing, NASA can send plans for new tools and equipment to the Space Station over email. Instead of waiting months for gear, Astronauts can print new gear in hours.
Steve Jobs named his company "Apple" partially because he wanted it to appear in the phone book before Atari, his former workplace.
During Prohibition, moonshiners would wear "cow shoes." The fancy footwear left hoofprints instead of footprints, helping distillers and smugglers evade police.

In 1947, after the price of a chocolate bar increased from 5 cents to 8 cents, 200 kids marched and protested on the capitol building in British Columbia, shutting down the government for a day. It is known as " The Candy Bar Strike"
Cards Against Humanity raised over $90,000 in donations to dig a hole for no reason.
After the release of the 1996 film 'Scream', which involved an anonymous killer calling and murdering his victims, Caller ID usage tripled in the United States.
1 centillion is 1 followed by 303 zeros.
A quarter has 119 grooves on its edge, a dime has one less groove!
The founders of Google were willing to sell Google for $1 million to Excite in 1999, but Excite turned them down. Google is now worth $527 Billion.
Our eyes are always the same size from birth, but our nose and ears never stop growing.
A broken clock is right two times every day.
One Incandescent Light Bulb uses the same amount of power as roughly five LED Light Bulbs
Paying for and giving out candy on halloween as an adult is like paying for the free candy you got as a kid.

Killer Whales are able to learn to speak Dolphin. When killer whales were socialized with bottlenose dolphins at a water facility, they changed the types of sounds they made to resemble those of their social partners
Nuclear power plants are one of the safest ways to generate energy, producing 100 times less radiation than coal plants. And they're 100% emission free.
Walmart loses $3 billion a year to theft
Millions of rickrolls has only earned Rick Astley $12

Color tells us about the temperature of a candle flame. The inner core of the candle flame is light blue, with a temperature of around 1670 K (1400 °C). That is the hottest part of the flame. The colour inside the flame becomes yellow, orange, and finally red.

Orville and Wilbur Wright designed and flew their Flyer plane in December 1903. Five people were said to have witnessed the flight including John T. Daniels who took photographic evidence. Claims that Whitehead beat the Wright Brothers to the record first emerged in 1937
Following the Battle of Actium in 31 BCE, Gaius Octavian Thurinus, Julius Caesar's nephew and heir, became the first emperor of Rome and took the name Augustus Caesar
Jean-Paul Sartre, awarded the 1964 Nobel Prize in Literature, declined the prize because he had consistently declined all official honours.
